issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
As going through the tag edit test cases, discovered that there is a noticeable delay when editing/deleting/creating tags.

However, the bigger issue is that sometimes the delete tag operation fails. Due to the delay in the UI, on the dialog, the tag is marked as deleted, thus not showing up. Later, as going through editing of the tags, all the previously "deleted" tags return to the dialog at once.

So, there are 2 issues here:

1. The UI needs to handle the failed-to-delete-tag cases.
2. The delay in updating the statues of the tags need to be improved.
fields.summary: Delay in tag update causes deleted tags to return

comments.body:
It's not a bug, rather improvement.

The UI needs to be able to handle create/delete operations and be clear on which operation failed, rather than silently reverting the failed operations.
Work on this issue is now contingent on the outcome of EUCA-6677.
Once all the databox stuff is merged, please see if this is still an issue and if not, close it.
On the latest 'testing', this issue was no longer detected.
Tags still return after deletion. See attached movie.

Something isn't right about that. With the pull request for EUCA-6587, you shouldn't see changes in the expando immediately like that. Only after the server answers back with the updated models, and we know for certain that the delete really happened.

The landing pages are doing some really weird things in testing branch today. An open expando will close and open again - not on the tab you had selected - when you click a checkbox. The expandos also don't seem to be updating with the collections anymore.

Fixed expando behavior and made sure tags are *not* being stuck in the model before the server creates them and returns the new data. Now there will be a second or so delay, more or less, between the save button click and when you see the tags update in the expando. That's the new normal, and it means we're not optomistically putting local changes in before the server says they're really part of the dataset.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/121
thanks [~jpommer]!
Kicked back - this solution broke something else more important.

My original solution to this was not allowing tags to be added to the model's tags collection before they were confirmed saved to the server. That works for tag edits, but for tags added to a new resource, before the resource has been saved, the tags *must* be added to the model. 

The new model does not yet have an ID, and so the tags do not have a resource ID, and are therefore invalid. The tags listen to changes in their resource model's ID field, and are saved or updated if it changes, as when the new resource is saved and receives its ID from the server.

This built-in behavior, while clever, doesn't lend itself to keeping the tags out of the display until confirmed saved to the server. Something else will have to be done.

[~jpommer]: We should probably punt this to 3.4.1 since we don't want to cause any other regressions at this point.

/cc [~tjcramer]
[~kgill] - Agreed.
OK by me. [~tjcramer], OK to punt this one to 3.4.1?
yes.
Hey Kamal, This was Jerry's, please reassign iof you can't work it.

Hi [~jpommer]: based on the ticket history, looks like the work for this was merged a while back in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/121 ?  Could we confirm and verify if any additional work is required here?

Hi [~kgill]. Here is the situation:

The current implementation of the tag model/collection is such that tags may be created on a resource that hasn't yet been saved to the server, and therefore doesn't yet have an ID, which is required by each tag model in the "res_id" (or "resource_id"?) attribute. 

The new tag model holds the tag data and sets listeners on the resource that the tag belongs to, listening for a change in the ID of that resource (such as a new volume having no ID then receiving an ID from the server when the save op is successful). When the resource gets its new ID, the new as-of-yet unsaved tags get that ID and store it in res_id, and are able to save (CreateTag is called).

That makes it possible to create a new volume model, add tags to it and save the volume, and let the tags take care of themselves when and if the volume creation is successful, and avoids having to do manual synchronous  work in nested "success" callbacks (which *are* done in some places). 

The side effect is when the new tags are added to the new resource model, they appear in the console immediately. Sticking with the volumes example, when the new volume is saved to the server and we get the update back from the proxy, the client-side volume model is updated and doesn't yet have a link to it's tags. The tags may seem to disappear from the model for a moment until the aforementioned tag save happens and the orphaned tags are linked back up with the volume, when they will reappear (and the opposite for deletions).

The obvious solution is not to add the tags to the model until all the save calls have completed successfully. The tags presently expect that for setting up the change listener on the resource's ID. I think we can stash the new tags somewhere else temporarily and pass in a model reference for them to listenTo instead.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/211

Got it worked out. The changes are small. Anything that uses tags will be affected though, so I confirmed that it all works with dialogs and wizards, new models, existing models, tag additions, edits, deletions. I feel pretty good about it.

Creating/Editing/Deleting tag time seems quite reasonable. For volumes updating tags is pretty fast, for instances it often needs few seconds to update.
